Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates wearing festival wreath headdress, with hair in side knot. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. White (gypsum?) coating. Dark brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. '8' on back in pencil. Parallels in Dresden are dated from the late 1st century Bc to early 1st century AD (Fischer 1994, nos 639, 643). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.083) (Phase 1)
